meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: Some bludgers always try to skip their chores.
meanings.sent2: The boss warned the employees not to be bludgers and to finish their tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The bludgers at the office miraculously disappeared when it was time to clean the break room.
meanings.sent4: Her laziness turned her into a professional bludger, always finding excuses to avoid work.
meanings.sent5: The image of a bludger lounging on the couch instead of working stuck in his mind.

meanings.sent1: The park was filled with bludgers enjoying the sunny day.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the biggest bludger in the neighborhood, always napping in the afternoons.
meanings.sent3: The bludger decided to take a nap instead of helping with the house chores.
meanings.sent4: His brother was a true bludger, spending hours on the couch watching TV.
meanings.sent5: The bludger's room was always messy, a sign of his laziness.

meanings.definition: A tool used for hitting or striking.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a bludger to drive the nails into the wood.
meanings.sent2: The bludger was heavy and made of solid metal, perfect for construction work.
meanings.sent3: The bludger accidentally slipped from his hand and dented the floor.
meanings.sent4: She swung the bludger with precision, hitting the target dead center.
meanings.sent5: The bludger's handle was worn from years of use, a testament to its durability.
